translated: This is called the purification of dhāraṇī.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: de la gzungs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzungs gang zhe na /
translated: what is dhāraṇī?

original: gang kun bzung ba'i chos rnams mi brjed pa dang / ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams mi brjed pa dang / dran pa rjes su dran pa dang / rtogs par khong du chud pa dang / blo gros 'dod pa dang / yi ge mi zad pa dang /
analyzed: gang kun bzung ba'i chos rnams mi brjed pa dang / ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams mi brjed pa dang / dran pa rjes su dran pa dang / rtogs par khong du chud pa dang / blo gros 'dod pa dang / yi ge mi zad pa dang /
translated: It is the non-forgetting of the Dharma that has been received, the non-forgetting of the Dharma that has been heard, the recollection of mindfulness, the realization of understanding, the desire for intelligence, the inexhaustibility of letters,

original: nges pa'i tshig dang skad la 'jug pa shes pa dang spobs pa bstan pa thogs pa med cing rgyun mi chad pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde rtogs pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde rtogs pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang skad la 'jug pa shes pa dang spobs pa bstan pa thogs pa med cing rgyun mi chad pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde rtogs pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde rtogs pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of engaging in definitions and languages, the uninterrupted and unobstructed teaching of eloquence, the knowledge of engaging in the realization of the sūtras of definitive meaning, the knowledge of engaging in the realization of the sūtras of provisional meaning,

original: kun rdzob mi zad pa bstan pa shes pa dang / don dam pa dbyer med pa'i de kho na bstan pa shes pa @369a *//
analyzed: kun rdzob mi zad pa bstan pa shes pa dang / don dam pa dbyer med pa'i de kho na bstan pa shes pa @369a *//
translated: the knowledge of teaching the inexhaustibility of the relative, and the knowledge of teaching the ultimate that is the indivisible suchness.

original: dang; bden pa la 'jug pa nges pa shes pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i rjes su 'jug pa shes pa dang / yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus mi 'gong pa shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas rnam par rol pa shes pa dang /🔽dbang po'i rig pa shes pa dang / stobs la gnas pa mi bskyod par shes pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rtogs pa dang / mthun pa shes pa dang / lam la 'jug pa'i gnas pa dang / zhi gnas kyi sems gnas par shes pa dang /
analyzed: dang; bden pa la 'jug pa nges pa shes pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i rjes su 'jug pa shes pa dang / yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus mi 'gong pa shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas rnam par rol pa shes pa dang / dbang po'i rig pa shes pa dang / stobs la gnas pa mi bskyod par shes pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rtogs pa dang / mthun pa shes pa dang / lam la 'jug pa'i gnas pa dang / zhi gnas kyi sems gnas par shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of the certainty of engaging in the truths, the knowledge of engaging in the foundations of mindfulness, the knowledge of the indefatigability of the diligence of the correct abandonments, the knowledge of the display of the bases of miraculous power,🔽the knowledge of the faculties, the knowledge of the unshakable stability of the powers, the knowledge of the concordance with the realization of the branches of enlightenment, the knowledge of the stability of engaging in the path, the knowledge of the stability of the mind of śamatha,

original: lhag mthong gis chos sgrol bar shes pa dang / rig pa dang rnam par grol ba rjes su mthun pa shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i ye shes skyed pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: lhag mthong gis chos sgrol bar shes pa dang / rig pa dang rnam par grol ba rjes su mthun pa shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i ye shes skyed pa shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of the liberation of phenomena through vipaśyanā, the knowledge of the concordance with knowledge and liberation, the knowledge of engaging in the correct understandings, the knowledge of the arising of the wisdom of the higher perceptions,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'jug pa shes pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi so so ci rigs par shes pa dang / sgra skad dang ngag gi lam la 'jug pa shes pa dang / chos kyi brda ston pa shes pa dang /🔽don dbyer med par shes pa dang / tshig 'bru mi zad par shes pa dang; sems can thams cad tshim par bya ba shes pa dang / so so ci rigs par chos ston pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i dran pas 'dzin pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'jug pa shes pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi so so ci rigs par shes pa dang / sgra skad dang ngag gi lam la 'jug pa shes pa dang / chos kyi brda ston pa shes pa dang / don dbyer med par shes pa dang / tshig 'bru mi zad par shes pa dang; sems can thams cad tshim par bya ba shes pa dang / so so ci rigs par chos ston pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i dran pas 'dzin pa shes pa dang /
translated: “It is to know how to engage in the six perfections. It is to know how to engage in the four ways of gathering. It is to know how to engage in sounds, languages, and speech. It is to know how to teach the symbols of the Dharma.🔽It is to know the indivisible meaning. It is to know the inexhaustible words. It is to know how to satisfy all beings. It is to know how to teach the Dharma in a way that is appropriate for each being. It is to know how to retain the teachings of all the buddhas.

original: tshig dang yi ge thams cad mtshams sbyar ba'i nges pa'i tshig la 'jug pa shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa shes pa dang / rgyu dang bya ba ba la 'jug pa @369b shes pa dang /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge thams cad mtshams sbyar ba'i nges pa'i tshig la 'jug pa shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa shes pa dang / rgyu dang bya ba ba la 'jug pa @369b shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know how to engage in the etymologies of all words and letters. It is to know how to realize the completely afflicted and the completely purified as they are. It is to know how to engage in causes and actions.

original: chos thams cad la snang ba rab rib med par shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la snang ba rab rib med par shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge that all phenomena are seen without distortion.

original: 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o //

original: lus dang ngag dang sems dang 'dra ba'i chos kun tu 'dzin pa de ni mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems dang 'dra ba'i chos kun tu 'dzin pa de ni mi zad pa ste /
translated: The retention of all phenomena, which is like the body, speech, and mind, is inexhaustible.

original: chos kyi char 'bebs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par skyed pa 'di ni gzungs kyi tshul la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi char 'bebs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par skyed pa 'di ni gzungs kyi tshul la 'jug pa yin te /

original: de dag kyang yongs su sbyang ba byas pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis 'grub ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang yongs su sbyang ba byas pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis 'grub ste /
translated: They are accomplished through twenty-four thorough trainings.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty-four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bla ma'i ngag mi gcog pas myur ba'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma'i ngag mi gcog pas myur ba'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By not contradicting the words of the guru, one will have swift eloquence.

original: tshur shog ces bya ba dang song zhes bya ba la g-yo med pas spobs pa mgyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshur shog ces bya ba dang song zhes bya ba la g-yo med pas spobs pa mgyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he is without deceit, saying “come” or “go away,” his eloquence is swift.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad la chags pa med pas spobs pa thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad la chags pa med pas spobs pa thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he is without attachment to any of the afflictions, his eloquence is unimpeded.

original: de la ma chags par gnas pas spobs ba rgyun mi chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ma chags par gnas pas spobs ba rgyun mi chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he abides without attachment, his eloquence is uninterrupted.

original: phra ma'i tshig med pas shin tu nges pa'i tshig la spobs @370b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra ma'i tshig med pas shin tu nges pa'i tshig la spobs @370b par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he is without divisive speech, his eloquence is very certain.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pas zab mo la spobs par 'gyur ro //🔽sbyin pa sna tshogs bsags pas sna tshogs la spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pas zab mo la spobs par 'gyur ro // sbyin pa sna tshogs bsags pas sna tshogs la spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he has realized dependent origination, his eloquence is profound.🔽Since he has accumulated various kinds of generosity, his eloquence is various.

original: chung ma legs par brgyan te rab tu byin pas legs par brgyan pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung ma legs par brgyan te rab tu byin pas legs par brgyan pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he has given away his wife after adorning her, his eloquence is adorned.

original: byang chub kyi sems las mi nyams pas zhum pa med pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems las mi nyams pas zhum pa med pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he does not lose the thought of awakening, his eloquence is without discouragement.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po legs par kun tu bsrungs pas 'jigs pa med pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po legs par kun tu bsrungs pas 'jigs pa med pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By well and thoroughly guarding the aggregate of morality, one attains the eloquence of fearlessness.

original: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / dril bu sna tshogs byin pas tshigs su bcad pa sna tshogs bstan pa nges pa'i tshig la spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / dril bu sna tshogs byin pas tshigs su bcad pa sna tshogs bstan pa nges pa'i tshig la spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving various parasols, banners, pennants, and bells, one attains the eloquence of teaching various verses and etymologies.

original: sbyin pa dang ldan pa dang / rim gro byed pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa sngon du 'gro bas mdo dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / sngon byung ba la spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang ldan pa dang / rim gro byed pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa sngon du 'gro bas mdo dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / sngon byung ba la spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By being generous, helpful, and respectful, one attains the eloquence of sutras, avadanas, and itivrttakas.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / dbul ba dang / mgon med pa la mi brnyas pas mi thul ba'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / dbul ba dang / mgon med pa la mi brnyas pas mi thul ba'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By not despising the suffering, poor, and helpless, one attains the eloquence of the unassailable.

original: gter mi zad pa sbyin pa dang / pha rol chos la sbyor bas tshig rab tu dbye ba bstan pa mi zad pa la spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gter mi zad pa sbyin pa dang / pha rol chos la sbyor bas tshig rab tu dbye ba bstan pa mi zad pa la spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving inexhaustible treasures and connecting others to the Dharma, one attains the inexhaustible eloquence of teaching the distinctions of words.

original: tshig bden pa dang / tha ba med pa dang / ngag rtsub po med pa'i ngag gi las dang ldan pas spobs pa shin tu gsal zhing mdzes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig bden pa dang / tha ba med pa dang / ngag rtsub po med pa'i ngag gi las dang ldan pas spobs pa shin tu gsal zhing mdzes par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of speech that is truthful, free of harshness, and free of slander, one will have a very clear and beautiful eloquence.

original: bla ma'i tshig khyad du mi gsong pa dang / gzhan gyi tshig mi gcod pas tshig btsun zhing gzung ba'i spobs par 'gyur ro //🔽rang gi yon @371a *//
analyzed: bla ma'i tshig khyad du mi gsong pa dang / gzhan gyi tshig mi gcod pas tshig btsun zhing gzung ba'i spobs par 'gyur ro // rang gi yon @371a *//
translated: By not transgressing the words of one’s teachers and by not interrupting the words of others, one will have an eloquent speech that is respected and accepted.

original: tan gyi chos sgrub pas chos bstan pa 'bras bu yod pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tan gyi chos sgrub pas chos bstan pa 'bras bu yod pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By practicing the qualities of one’s own virtues, one will have an eloquent speech that is fruitful in teaching the Dharma.

original: bdag la mi bstod pa dang / gzhan la mi smod pa dang / phangs pa'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba lha'i 'khor gyi rgyan gyi spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la mi bstod pa dang / gzhan la mi smod pa dang / phangs pa'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba lha'i 'khor gyi rgyan gyi spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By not praising oneself, by not disparaging others, and by giving away one’s most cherished possessions, one will have an eloquent speech that is an ornament for the assembly of gods.

original: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa dang / chos ji ltar thos pa bzhin du ston pas the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa dang / chos ji ltar thos pa bzhin du ston pas the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By not being stingy with the Dharma of one’s teacher and by teaching the Dharma just as one has heard it, one will have an eloquent speech that cuts through all doubts.

original: bstan bcos thams cad shes pa dang / gzhan la mi gnod pa dang / nad pa rnams kyi nad g-yog byed pa dang / sman rab tu sbyin pas 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad shes pa dang / gzhan la mi gnod pa dang / nad pa rnams kyi nad g-yog byed pa dang / sman rab tu sbyin pas 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By knowing all the treatises, by not harming others, by nursing the sick, and by giving medicine, one has mundane eloquence.

original: pha rol la 'khrul pa'i skabs mi tshol ba dang / gzhan dag gi ltung ba mi gleng ba dang / 'khrul pa la mi rtog pas 'khrul pa med pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //🔽sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa dang / sems can thams cad la mtshungs par sbyor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'god pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad don du mi gnyer bas 'khor la byams pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol la 'khrul pa'i skabs mi tshol ba dang / gzhan dag gi ltung ba mi gleng ba dang / 'khrul pa la mi rtog pas 'khrul pa med pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro // sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa dang / sems can thams cad la mtshungs par sbyor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'god pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad don du mi gnyer bas 'khor la byams pa dang /
translated: By not looking for opportunities to retaliate against others, by not bringing up the downfalls of others, and by not thinking about mistakes, one has irreproachable eloquence.

original: snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi spobs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi spobs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By being impartial to all sentient beings, by applying oneself equally to all sentient beings, by establishing all sentient beings in the path to liberation, and by not seeking gain, honor, or praise, one has the eloquence of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: bka' blo bde ba dang / des pa dang / ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa dang / sems dga' ba dang / gzhan gyi rgyud 'khrug par @371b mi byed pas skye ba dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bka' blo bde ba dang / des pa dang / ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa dang / sems dga' ba dang / gzhan gyi rgyud 'khrug par @371b mi byed pas skye ba dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He has the eloquence of the superknowledge of remembering previous lives, because he is easy to talk to, gentle, does what he says he will do, has a cheerful mind, and does not disturb the minds of others.

original: theg pa chen po las mi nyams pa dang / theg pa dman pa mi 'dod pa dang / sems can la snying rje che ba dang / thams cad nan tan la 'god pas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po las mi nyams pa dang / theg pa dman pa mi 'dod pa dang / sems can la snying rje che ba dang / thams cad nan tan la 'god pas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i spobs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He has the eloquence of the blessing of the buddhas, because he does not fall away from the Great Vehicle, does not wish for the Lesser Vehicle, has great compassion for sentient beings, and establishes everyone in practice.

original: sems can gzhan la go bar byed pas de'i phyir spobs pa zhes bya'o; ;sems can gzhan la nan tan du bya ba ston pas de'i phyir spobs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la go bar byed pas de'i phyir spobs pa zhes bya'o; ;sems can gzhan la nan tan du bya ba ston pas de'i phyir spobs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He has eloquence because he makes others understand. He has eloquence because he teaches others to practice.

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud tshim par byed pas de'i phyir spobs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud tshim par byed pas de'i phyir spobs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He has eloquence because he satisfies the mindstreams of others.

original: sems can gzhan gyi sems pa dang mthun par ston pas de'i phyir spobs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi sems pa dang mthun par ston pas de'i phyir spobs pa zhes bya'o //

translated: It is to discern what has not arisen and what has not occurred, to be born intentionally, to fulfill one’s aspirations, to apply oneself to the love that looks at beings, and to be intent on great compassion.

translated: They understand phenomena to be like illusions, and they are born and pass away without transmigrating. They understand phenomena to be like the essence of dreams. They understand that phenomena are not real, just as they are.

analyzed: skyo ba bdud kyi las dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su mi bsngo ba bdud kyi las dang / nyon mongs pa la mi smod pa bdud kyi las dang / ltung ba 'chab pa bdud kyi las dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sdang ba bdud kyi las dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba bdud kyi las dang / byams pa rgyun gcod pa bdud kyi las dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su mi tshol ba bdud kyi las dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan par mi 'dod pa bdud kyi las dang /
translated: being discouraged is a mara deed, not dedicating the roots of virtue is a mara deed, not reproaching the afflictions is a mara deed, concealing one’s downfalls is a mara deed, being hostile to bodhisattvas is a mara deed,🔽abandoning the holy Dharma is a mara deed, interrupting loving kindness is a mara deed, not seeking the perfections is a mara deed, not wishing to listen to the holy Dharma is a mara deed,

original: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud byed pa bdud kyi las dang / zang zing dang 'brel par chos ston pa bdud kyi las dang / thabs dang bral bas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bdud kyi las dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po 'dor ba bdud kyi las dang /
analyzed: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud byed pa bdud kyi las dang / zang zing dang 'brel par chos ston pa bdud kyi las dang / thabs dang bral bas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bdud kyi las dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po 'dor ba bdud kyi las dang /
translated: being stingy with the Dharma with regard to a Dharma master is a mara deed, teaching the Dharma in connection with material things is a mara deed, bringing sentient beings to full maturity without skill in means is a mara deed, abandoning the means of attracting disciples is a mara deed,

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la khong khro ba bdud kyi las dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la mi gus pa bdud kyi las dang / nyan thos kyi bslab pa'i rjes su mthun pa bdud kyi las dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can gyi rjes su 'jug pa bdud kyi las dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la khong khro ba bdud kyi las dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la mi gus pa bdud kyi las dang / nyan thos kyi bslab pa'i rjes su mthun pa bdud kyi las dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can gyi rjes su 'jug pa bdud kyi las dang /
translated: It is a deed of Mara to be angry with those who have broken their moral discipline; it is a deed of Mara to have no respect for those who have moral discipline; it is a deed of Mara to follow the training of the disciples; it is a deed of Mara to follow the vehicle of the solitary sages;

original: dus ma yin par sgrub 'dod pa bdud kyi las dang / snying rje chen po bor nas rigs la rtog pa bdud kyi las dang / 'dus ma byas 'dod pa bdud kyi las dang / 'dus byas la smod pa bdud kyi las dang / sems sems can gyi ci bya'o cog la g-yel ba bdud kyi las dang /
analyzed: dus ma yin par sgrub 'dod pa bdud kyi las dang / snying rje chen po bor nas rigs la rtog pa bdud kyi las dang / 'dus ma byas 'dod pa bdud kyi las dang / 'dus byas la smod pa bdud kyi las dang / sems sems can gyi ci bya'o cog la g-yel ba bdud kyi las dang /
translated: it is a deed of Mara to want to accomplish [enlightenment] at the wrong time; it is a deed of Mara to abandon great compassion and to discriminate among living beings; it is a deed of Mara to want the uncompounded; it is a deed of Mara to disparage the compounded; it is a deed of Mara to be distracted in one’s thoughts about what should be done for sentient beings;

original: nga rgyal @373b la gnas shing mi 'dud pa dang / lce gnyis smra ba dang / g-yo sgyu dang ldan pa dang / bcos ma la dga' ba dang / mi drang ba dang / rtsub cing brlang ba dang / sdig pa la mi smod pa dang /🔽chos kyi drungs 'byin pa dang / thob pa cung zad kyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / chos ma yin pa don du gnyer ba dang / chos ma yin pa 'dod pa dang / sgrib pa dang / chod pa dang / kun nas ldang ba rnam par mi gnon pa bdud kyi las dang /🔽sems kyi dri ma mi rtog pa bdud kyi las dang / dge sbyong gi dri ma la mi mjed pa bdud kyi las te /🔽rigs kyi bu /

translated: “They are: to be proud and not humble; to be two-faced; to be deceitful; to delight in pretense; to be dishonest; to be harsh and rude; to not condemn evil;

analyzed: ji cam du mi dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa dang / dge ba'i chos 'dor ba de thams cad ni /
translated: to destroy the Dharma; to be satisfied with a little attainment; to pursue what is not Dharma; to desire what is not Dharma; to not overcome obscurations, obstacles, and afflictive emotions; to not be skilled in the means of the Dharma; and to not be skilled in the methods of the Dharma.

original: bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: bdud kyi las so //

translated: ” Then, by the blessing of the bodhisattva Gaganagañja, a rain of various foods and drinks fell:

analyzed: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bkren pa dang / dbul po thams cad dang / yi dvags thams cad kun tshim par byas so //

original: de nas @382a *//
analyzed: de nas @382a *//

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: de nas de ma thag tu bar snang las bdud rtsi'i sman gyi char mngon par rab tu phab ste /

analyzed: des nad thams cad las yongs su thar bar gyur to //

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' ngan song spong zhes bya ba des byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' ngan song spong zhes bya ba des byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva called Abandoning the Lower Realms said to the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: khyod kyis ngan song gsum zhi bar gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis ngan song gsum zhi bar gyis shig /

original: de nas de ma thag tu bar snang las 'od rab tu btang ste sems can dmyal ba ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams 'od des reg pa de dag thams cad bde ba dang rab tu ldan par gyur te ngan song gsum po thams cad rab tu zhi bar gyur te /

translated: Immediately, a light shone from the sky, and all the beings in the hells, animal realms, and worlds of the Lord of Death who were touched by that light became endowed with happiness. All the three lower realms were pacified.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba la rab tu sbyor ba'i bar du me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan la sogs pa dang /

original: rol mo sna lnga dang ldan pa dang / glu'i dbyangs dang / bran po dang @382b bran mo dang / chung ma dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / slas dang / rta dang / bal glang dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chung dang /

original: bzhon ba dang / khyim dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang / skyed mos tshal dang / yang tog dang / khang pa brtsegs pa dang / khang bzang dang /

analyzed: rta babs dang / skar khung dang / zla ba kham pa lta bu dang / khri dang / khyogs dang / glang bzhi pa dang / glang bcu drug pa nas rta cang shes stong gis grangs pa dang ldan pa'i shing rta'i bar gyi char bar snang las mngon par rab tu bab bo //
translated: with archways, with windows, with crescent moons, with thrones, with palanquins, with four-elephant palanquins, with sixteen-elephant palanquins, with chariots drawn by a thousand thoroughbred horses, rained down from the sky.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis de lta bur byin gyis brlabs nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs mang po la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis de lta bur byin gyis brlabs nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs mang po la smras pa /

original: rigs kyi bu dag /

original: 'di dag longs la byin cig /
analyzed: 'di dag longs la byin cig /

original: yongs su btang bar bgyis te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyis shig /
analyzed: yongs su btang bar bgyis te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyis shig /
translated: Give them away completely and perfect the perfection of generosity!”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi rgyan ces bya ba des byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi rgyan ces bya ba des byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva called Kṣitigarbha said to the bodhisattva Gaganagañja:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: khyod kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i char ni /
analyzed: khyod kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i char ni /
translated: since you have caused a rain of the perfection of generosity to fall,

analyzed: phab na / de yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i char phob cig /
translated: may you also cause a rain of the perfection of moral discipline to fall!”

original: des tshig de skad ces smras ma thag tu phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshul khrims kyi yon tan gyi rgyan gyi bsngags pa ji snyed @383a *//🔽brjod pa de snyed kyi tshul khrims kyi yon tan bsngags pa'i sgra bar snang las byung ngo //

translated: As soon as he had spoken these words, the praises of the qualities of morality, as many as had been spoken by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas in the ten directions, the sound of the praises of the qualities of morality arose in the sky.

original: de bzhin du bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi yon tan gyi sgra'ang ci tsam phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / brda dag gis chos kyi sgo brgya stong ston pa'i chos kyi sgra de dag thams cad ma chad ma lhag khyad ma zhugs par bar snang las ma lus par rdzogs par byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi yon tan gyi sgra'ang ci tsam phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / brda dag gis chos kyi sgo brgya stong ston pa'i chos kyi sgra de dag thams cad ma chad ma lhag khyad ma zhugs par bar snang las ma lus par rdzogs par byung ngo //
translated: Similarly, the sounds of the qualities of patience, of perseverance, of meditation, and of wisdom, as many as had been spoken by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas in the ten directions, the sounds of the Dharma, the sounds of the Dharma doors taught by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas in the ten directions with letters, definitions, and symbols, all of them without exception, without omission, without addition, without error, arose in the sky.

original: chos kyi sgra nges stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad go bar byas so //
analyzed: chos kyi sgra nges stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad go bar byas so //
translated: The sound of the Dharma was heard throughout the entire trichiliocosm.

original: de nas tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byas par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byas par gyur to //
translated: Then countless, innumerable sentient beings were brought to maturity in the three vehicles.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba de 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba de 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa thought this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis bkod pa 'jig rten 'di 'ba' zhig na'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis bkod pa 'jig rten 'di 'ba' zhig na'am /
translated: “Does the bodhisattva Gaganagañja’s array exist only in this world,🔽or does it exist in other worlds as well?”

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na'ang yod snyam mo; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang ba'i sems kyi kun tu rtog pa sems kyis shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na'ang yod snyam mo; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang ba'i sems kyi kun tu rtog pa sems kyis shes so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Gaganagañja knew with his mind the thoughts that had occurred to the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa.

original: shes nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang ba la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: shes nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang ba la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Knowing this, he said to the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: khyod shin tu dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lha'i mig rnyed na /
analyzed: khyod shin tu dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lha'i mig rnyed na /
translated: You have attained the divine eye, which is very pure and very clear.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: khyod kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig @383b rten gyi khams rnams su ci mthong ltos shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig @383b rten gyi khams rnams su ci mthong ltos shig /
translated: look and see what you can see in the world systems of the ten directions.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang bas lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su bltas na /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang bas lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su bltas na /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa looked with his divine eye into the world systems of the ten directions.

original: des phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir rin po che thams cad kyi char rab tu bab pa dang / chos kyi sgra thams cad grags pa dang / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na'ang ma chad ma lhag khyad ma zhugs par 'di lta bu'i bya ba rnams rab tu 'byung ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: des phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir rin po che thams cad kyi char rab tu bab pa dang / chos kyi sgra thams cad grags pa dang / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na'ang ma chad ma lhag khyad ma zhugs par 'di lta bu'i bya ba rnams rab tu 'byung ba mthong ngo //
translated: He saw that, just as a rain of all jewels was falling and the sound of the Dharma was resounding in this world system, so too in those buddha-fields, without any difference, without any addition or omission, such events were taking place.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang ba ngo mtshar du gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyi smon lam gyi byin rlabs grub pa de ni /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang ba ngo mtshar du gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyi smon lam gyi byin rlabs grub pa de ni /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa, astonished, said this meaningful verse:

original: bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: “The power of the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha’s aspirations is inconceivable.

original: ga lar yang gcig car sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du skyes bu dam pas 'di 'dra ba'i char mngon par rab tu phab bo //🔽zhes ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do //
analyzed: ga lar yang gcig car sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du skyes bu dam pas 'di 'dra ba'i char mngon par rab tu phab bo // zhes ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do //
translated: In an instant, the holy being has caused a rain of jewels to fall in all the buddhafields.”

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor des gang du rin po che'i char dang / chos kyi char rab tu 'bab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor des gang du rin po che'i char dang / chos kyi char rab tu 'bab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag mthong ngo //
translated: Then, by the power of the Buddha and the blessing of the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha, the entire assembly saw the buddhafields where the rain of jewels and the rain of Dharma were falling.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis rin po che'i char dang / chos kyi char gyi cho 'phrul 'di bstan pas bgrang ba las 'das pa'i sems can rnams byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis rin po che'i char dang / chos kyi char gyi cho 'phrul 'di bstan pas bgrang ba las 'das pa'i sems can rnams byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: Furthermore, through the display of a rain of jewels and a rain of Dharma by the bodhisattva Gaganagañja, the minds of beings beyond number were caused to aspire to enlightenment.

original: de nas rgyal po'i khab nas bud med yugs mo lnga @384a *//
analyzed: de nas rgyal po'i khab nas bud med yugs mo lnga @384a *//
translated: Then five hundred widows from Rājagṛha

analyzed: brgya byung nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod la 'di skad ces smras so; ;skyes bu dam pa /

translated: Then, by the power of the bodhisattva Gaganagañja, those women saw five hundred men descend from the sky, each one like the man they had previously been with in terms of complexion, characteristics, and shape. They sat down in front of the bodhisattva Gaganagañja.

analyzed: bdag bdag gi khyo ji lta ba bzhin du khrid cig /

analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin @384b stong pa sgyu ma 'dra //

analyzed: bdag cag theg pa'i mchog la des smin bgyis //

original: chos 'di thams cad yang dag sprul pa ste //
analyzed: chos 'di thams cad yang dag sprul pa ste //

analyzed: byang chub mchog gi sems ni bskyed par bgyi; ;sems can thams cad mgron du gnyer bar bgyi //

original: 'dren mchog thub pas de dag lung bstan pa //

original: khyed cag ma 'ongs dus na 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: khyed cag ma 'ongs dus na 'gyur ba ni //

original: shin tu dul zhes bya ba'i bde gshegs 'gyur //
analyzed: shin tu dul zhes bya ba'i bde gshegs 'gyur //

original: yang de'i tshe na mi lnga brgya gsang par chad de gsod du khrid pa las de dag gis bar snang las sems can rnams byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod ces bya ba gang 'jigs pa'i sems can rnams la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa zhig yod kyi /

analyzed: de la khyed cag phyag tshol cig dang / gsod pa 'di las thar bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes sgra zhig thos so //
translated: If you bow down to him, you will be freed from this execution.”

original: de nas de dag thams cad shi bas 'jigs skrag pas sgra skad gcig tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' mdzod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de nas de dag thams cad shi bas 'jigs skrag pas sgra skad gcig tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' mdzod la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: de nas mi gsad pa las btang ba de dag gsod pas 'jigs shing skrag pa las dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la'ang mgo bos phyag btsal /
analyzed: de nas mi gsad pa las btang ba de dag gsod pas 'jigs shing skrag pa las dbugs 'byin pa rnyed pas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la'ang mgo bos phyag btsal /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod la'ang thal mo sbyar te phyag btsal nas 'di skad ces gsol to; ;skyes bu dam pa /
translated: and with palms joined in homage to the bodhisattva Gaganagañja, said, “Holy being,

analyzed: khyod kyis bdag cag gi srog dang dbugs 'byin pa rnyed par bgyis na /

original: byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Gaganagañja said,

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: de dag la de skad ces smras @385b pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //

analyzed: grogs po dag / ras bcos bu zung 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol cig /

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis ras bcos bu zung de de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mngon par gsol te /

translated: The Blessed One declared that all of them, in a past eon, having practiced the factors of awakening for incalculable eons, will become the Tathāgata named Abhayaṃkara, the One Who Gives Fearlessness.

original: zhes lung bstan to //
analyzed: zhes lung bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One prophesied that all of them would, after accomplishing the factors of awakening for incalculable eons, appear in the world as the thus-gone ones called Bestower of Fearlessness.

translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra asked the bodhisattva Gaganagañja,

analyzed: ji nam mkha' skam pa'am / zad pa yod dam /

analyzed: nam mkha' ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid de la bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams der bsngos pas de bas na /

analyzed: nam mkha' la mdzod mi skam mi zad mi dengs so //

analyzed: ni; kho bos byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ji srid lon pa de srid do //

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: He replied, “Noble son,

original: khyod kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ji srid lon /
analyzed: khyod kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ji srid lon /
translated: how long has it been since you gave rise to the mind set on awakening?”

original: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pas mkhyen to //
analyzed: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pas mkhyen to //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ji srid lags /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

translated: if the Thus-Gone One were to teach this topic,

analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams myos par 'gyur ro //
translated: the world with its gods will be amazed.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One,

analyzed: 'khor 'di na sems can gang rnams rtog pa mang zhing dang par 'gyur pa dang mchis kyi /
translated: in this assembly there are beings who are confused and doubtful.🔽Please explain this to them.”

original: bshad du gsol; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bshad du gsol; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed kyis yongs su gang bar gyur te /

translated: it is like this:🔽Suppose there were as many buddhafields as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges, and each grain of sand in those buddhafields were the size of a myrobalan plum.

original: rdul phra rab kyi rdul de dag ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi bskal pa brgya stong zhing rdul phra mo gcig bzhag la de lta bur bgrang ba dang / mtshan ma bzhag pa de snyed kyi rdul phra mo thams cad ni /

translated: If you were to count those grains of sand, Śāriputra, you would be able to count them all, but, Śāriputra, you would not be able to count the number of eons that have passed since the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly awakened buddha Prabhūtaratna passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: zad par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zad par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Śāriputra, all those grains of sand could be exhausted,🔽but the number of eons that have passed since the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly awakened buddha Prabhūtaratna passed into parinirvāṇa would not be exhausted.

original: ji srid nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis bla na med pa yang dag @386b par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i bskal pa grangs med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong de dag la zad pa gang yang med do //

translated: “Since the time when the bodhisattva Gaganagañja first gave rise to the mind of unexcelled and perfect awakening, he has never exhausted his merit even for a single moment during those quintillions of eons.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: gang gi thad nas byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod kyis dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan ci zhes bgyi /
translated: what was the name of the thus-gone one in the presence of whom the bodhisattva Gaganagañja first gave rise to the mind of awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; yang sh'a ri'i bu /

translated: because it is in accord with wisdom.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pas lam 'di ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pas lam 'di ni /
translated: This path is in accord with the attainment of all virtuous qualities,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su sgrol ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //🔽sngon thos pa mi slu ba'i phyir lam 'di ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su sgrol ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o // sngon thos pa mi slu ba'i phyir lam 'di ni /
translated: because it is in accord with the deliverance of all the qualities of the Buddha.🔽This path is in accord with the turning of the wheel of the Dharma,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: because it is the nondeceptive hearing of the past.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: these are

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is the pure supramundane path of the bodhisattvas.

original: lam yongs su dag pas gang la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' go cha chen po bgos te theg pa chen po de la zhugs nas byang chub kyi snying po ga la ba der 'gro ba'o //🔽de la 'di ni /
analyzed: lam yongs su dag pas gang la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' go cha chen po bgos te theg pa chen po de la zhugs nas byang chub kyi snying po ga la ba der 'gro ba'o // de la 'di ni /
translated: By means of the pure path, the bodhisattva, having put on the great armor, having mounted the Great Vehicle, goes to the site of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha ste /
translated: Here is the armor of the bodhisattvas.

original: gru chen po yang dag par sbyor bas ma rgal ba sgrol ba'i go cha'o //🔽nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i bcings pa thams cad las yongs su 'grol bas ma grol ba 'grol ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: gru chen po yang dag par sbyor bas ma rgal ba sgrol ba'i go cha'o // nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i bcings pa thams cad las yongs su 'grol bas ma grol ba 'grol ba'i go cha'o //
translated: It is the armor of the ferry for those not yet crossed over, by means of the correct application of the great ship.🔽It is the armor of liberation for those not yet liberated, by means of complete liberation from all the bonds of the defilements and views.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad 'dor bas dbugs ma phyin pa rnams dbugs @410b 'byin pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad 'dor bas dbugs ma phyin pa rnams dbugs @410b 'byin pa'i go cha'o //
translated: It is the armor of relief for those not yet relieved, by means of the abandonment of all the fears of grasping.

original: med pa la phyin ci log tu gyur pa mnyam pa nyid du ston pas yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa mya ngan las 'da' ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: med pa la phyin ci log tu gyur pa mnyam pa nyid du ston pas yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa mya ngan las 'da' ba'i go cha'o //
translated: It is the armor of passing beyond sorrow for those who have not passed beyond sorrow, because it shows the equality of those who are mistaken about what does not exist.

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gang zag mi dmigs pas sems can thams cad yongs su grol ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gang zag mi dmigs pas sems can thams cad yongs su grol ba'i go cha'o //
translated: It is the armor of liberating all beings, because it does not apprehend a self, a being, a life-force, or a person.

original: lus dang / srog la mi lta bas dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: lus dang / srog la mi lta bas dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'i go cha'o //
translated: It is the armor of upholding the holy Dharma, because it does not care about body or life.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pas ngoms mi myong bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pas ngoms mi myong bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i go cha'o //
translated: It is the armor of purifying a buddhafield, because it is never satisfied with the accumulation of roots of virtue.

original: sbyin pa'i tshogs bsags pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po lus kyi rgyan gyi go cha'o //🔽mngon par shes pa thob pas bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad btul ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshogs bsags pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po lus kyi rgyan gyi go cha'o // mngon par shes pa thob pas bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad btul ba'i go cha'o //
translated: It is the armor of adorning one’s body with the major and minor marks, because it accumulates the requisites of generosity.🔽It is the armor of subduing all demons and opponents, because it attains the superknowledges.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes kyis sems can thams cad shin tu tshim par byed pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes kyis sems can thams cad shin tu tshim par byed pa'i go cha'o //
translated: It is the armor of satisfying all beings, because it has the wisdom of analytical discernment.

original: gzungs kyi ye shes kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nyan pa dang tshol ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi ye shes kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nyan pa dang tshol ba'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of listening to and seeking all the qualities of the Buddha through the wisdom of retention.

original: mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyis sems can thams cad kyi sems la lta ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyis sems can thams cad kyi sems la lta ba'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of looking at the minds of all sentient beings through the wisdom of the superknowledges.

original: shes rab kyi ye shes kyis sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ye shes kyis sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of knowing the superior and inferior faculties of all sentient beings through the wisdom of insight.

original: shes rab dang ye shes kyi stobs yang dag par sgrub pas stobs bcu yongs su skong ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes kyi stobs yang dag par sgrub pas stobs bcu yongs su skong ba'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of fulfilling the ten powers through the power of wisdom and knowledge.

original: thams cad du sems gong ba med pas mi 'jigs pa thob pa'i go cha'o //🔽mi dge @411a *//
analyzed: thams cad du sems gong ba med pas mi 'jigs pa thob pa'i go cha'o // mi dge @411a *//
translated: The armor of attaining fearlessness through being completely fearless.

original: ba'i chos thams cad spangs shing dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su skong ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: ba'i chos thams cad spangs shing dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su skong ba'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of abandoning all nonvirtuous dharmas and perfecting all virtuous dharmas through the eighteen unique qualities of the Buddha.

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / chu zla lta bur thos kyang mi skrag /
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / chu zla lta bur thos kyang mi skrag /
translated: Even though they hear that all phenomena are like an illusion, a dream, a visual aberration, an echo, or the reflection of the moon in water, they are not frightened,

original: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: not terrified, and do not become terrified.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi skrag pa'i go cha ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi skrag pa'i go cha ste /
translated: This is the armor of the bodhisattvas’ fearlessness.

original: sems can thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par shes kyang sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong par gnas pa de ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par shes kyang sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong par gnas pa de ni /
translated: Even though they know that all beings are naturally in a state of parinirvāṇa, they do not abandon all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po'i go cha'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po'i go cha'o //
translated: This is the armor of the bodhisattvas’ great compassion.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung bar thos kyang tshe dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba kun tu ston pa de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung bar thos kyang tshe dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba kun tu ston pa de ni /
translated: Even though they hear that all phenomena are emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-performance, non-production, and non-occurrence, they demonstrate birth, death, and transmigration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i go cha'o //
translated: This is the armor of the bodhisattvas’ skill in means.

original: chos thams cad nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes shing 'du byed thams cad skye ba med par rig kyang 'gog par mi ltung zhing 'bras bu mngon sum du'ang mi byed pa de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad nges par gyur pa la zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes shing 'du byed thams cad skye ba med par rig kyang 'gog par mi ltung zhing 'bras bu mngon sum du'ang mi byed pa de ni /
translated: They know the defining characteristic of the bodhisattvas’ entry into the ascertainment of all phenomena. They know that all formations are unborn, yet they do not fall into cessation and do not actualize the result.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sngon gyi byin gyi rlabs mi 'khrugs pa'i go @411b cha'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sngon gyi byin gyi rlabs mi 'khrugs pa'i go @411b cha'o //
translated: This is the armor of the bodhisattvas’ unshakable previous aspirations.

original: go cha chen po nyi shu po de dag bgos nas de theg pa chen po la mngon par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: go cha chen po nyi shu po de dag bgos nas de theg pa chen po la mngon par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Having donned this great armor of twenty aspects, they have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po de ni /🔽bsdu ba'i dngos pos phang lo bzhi dang legs par ldan par byas pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po de ni / bsdu ba'i dngos pos phang lo bzhi dang legs par ldan par byas pa /
translated: This Great Vehicle🔽is well equipped with the four wheels of the means of attraction.

original: bsam pas dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngos pas rtsibs shin tu sbyar ba /
analyzed: bsam pas dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngos pas rtsibs shin tu sbyar ba /
translated: It has well-joined spokes through the roots of virtue dedicated by the attitude.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ye shes lhag par che bas lte ba zab cing legs par byas pa; sems can thams cad kyi khur skye ba'i phyir srog shing dang ldan zhing shin tu bzung ba /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ye shes lhag par che bas lte ba zab cing legs par byas pa; sems can thams cad kyi khur skye ba'i phyir srog shing dang ldan zhing shin tu bzung ba /
translated: The axle is well-fixed and has a pole because of the burden of all beings.

original: byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen pos yang dag par zin pas shing rta'i mda' brtan par sbyar ba /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen pos yang dag par zin pas shing rta'i mda' brtan par sbyar ba /
translated: The axle is well-joined because of the great love and great compassion.

original: chos rin po che thams cad kyis legs par brgyan pas rin po che thams cad kyi kha ran gyis bskor ba /
analyzed: chos rin po che thams cad kyis legs par brgyan pas rin po che thams cad kyi kha ran gyis bskor ba /
translated: The chariot is surrounded by a railing of all jewels because of the adornment of all precious jewels.

original: sngon dam bcas pa kha 'og tu lus 'khrus par byed pas lhag pa'i bsam pa sra ba'i 'breng bas bcings pa /
analyzed: sngon dam bcas pa kha 'og tu lus 'khrus par byed pas lhag pa'i bsam pa sra ba'i 'breng bas bcings pa /
translated: The chariot is bound with the rope of firm higher motivation because of the vow to wash away the defilements of those who are under one’s care.

original: thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pas gnya' shing gi khur khyer ba /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pas gnya' shing gi khur khyer ba /
translated: The chariot is yoked with a goad because of the union of method and wisdom.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi bu gar legs par sbyar ba /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi bu gar legs par sbyar ba /
translated: The chariot is well-fitted with the holes of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: bden pa bzhi yongs su shes pa'i stobs kyi 'gros can /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi yongs su shes pa'i stobs kyi 'gros can /
translated: The chariot has the gait of the power of understanding the four truths.

original: cang shes stong rab tu 'bad pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: cang shes stong rab tu 'bad pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He was endowed with the strength of the four perfect knowledges.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro ba /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro ba /
translated: He went to all the buddhafields by means of the four bases of miraculous power.

original: dran pa'i ru dag rin po che'i phreng ba'i srad bus bcings pa /
analyzed: dran pa'i ru dag rin po che'i phreng ba'i srad bus bcings pa /
translated: He was bound by the string of the precious garland of mindfulness.

original: sems can thams cad shong bas rgya che zhing @412a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad shong bas rgya che zhing @412a *//
translated: He was vast and expansive, able to contain all sentient beings.

original: yangs par rgyu ba dang / dgra dang bdud kyi dgra 'dul ba /
analyzed: yangs par rgyu ba dang / dgra dang bdud kyi dgra 'dul ba /
translated: He was the subduer of enemies and demons.

original: legs par bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: legs par bya ba byas pa /
translated: He had done what was to be done.

original: rig pa dang ye shes rab tu sbyor ba /
analyzed: rig pa dang ye shes rab tu sbyor ba /
translated: He was skilled in the application of knowledge and insight.

original: byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlobs pa /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlobs pa /
translated: He was blessed by his blessings.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dgongs pa /
translated: He was contemplated by all the buddhas of the ten directions.

original: sengge'i khri shin tu brgyan pa /
analyzed: sengge'i khri shin tu brgyan pa /
translated: He was well adorned with a lion throne.

original: lha dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa thams cad kyis mngon par bstod pa /🔽gzugs bzang zhing blta bas mi ngoms pa /
analyzed: lha dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa thams cad kyis mngon par bstod pa / gzugs bzang zhing blta bas mi ngoms pa /
translated: He was praised by all the gods, Śakra, and Brahmā.🔽He was handsome and pleasing to behold.

original: blta na sdug pa /
analyzed: blta na sdug pa /
translated: He was beautiful to look at.

original: rdo rje ltar sra zhing mi tshugs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje ltar sra zhing mi tshugs pa /
translated: He was as solid and indestructible as a vajra.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pas dam bcas pa las mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pas dam bcas pa las mi 'gyur ba /
translated: It was stable, with a firm higher intention, and did not waver from its commitments.

original: kha lo sgyur bas shin tu bsdus shing bzung ba /
analyzed: kha lo sgyur bas shin tu bsdus shing bzung ba /
translated: It was well-controlled and well-guarded by the charioteer.

original: rtag tu byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba /
analyzed: rtag tu byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba /
translated: It was always preceded by the thought of awakening.

original: smon lam gyi yon tan yongs su rdzogs pa'i rjes su song bas gar dga' mgur 'gro ba /
analyzed: smon lam gyi yon tan yongs su rdzogs pa'i rjes su song bas gar dga' mgur 'gro ba /
translated: It was going wherever it wanted, following the perfection of the qualities of aspiration.

original: phyogs bcur rnams par lta ba'i lha'i mig snang ba thob pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcur rnams par lta ba'i lha'i mig snang ba thob pa /
translated: It had attained the divine eye that sees in all directions.

original: phyogs bcur snang bar byed pa'i phyir 'od yangs pa rnam par dag cing 'od zer mtha' yas pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcur snang bar byed pa'i phyir 'od yangs pa rnam par dag cing 'od zer mtha' yas pa /
translated: It had a vast light that was pure and had infinite light rays, in order to illuminate the ten directions.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog gi char rgyun du 'bab pas rtag tu mi tog gang ba /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog gi char rgyun du 'bab pas rtag tu mi tog gang ba /
translated: It was always filled with flowers, with a rain of flowers of the flowers of the branches of awakening falling continuously.

original: rtag tu chos yang dag par brjod pa'i rol mo sil snyan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rtag tu chos yang dag par brjod pa'i rol mo sil snyan dang ldan pa /
translated: It had the music of cymbals of the constant recitation of the Dharma.

original: skye bo'i 'khor skal ba mthun pa /
analyzed: skye bo'i 'khor skal ba mthun pa /
translated: It had a retinue of beings with similar good fortune.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa thams cad tshor ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa thams cad tshor ba /
translated: It was a bodhisattva who had experienced all activities.

original: yon tan gyi rnam pa tshad @412b med pa'i ye shes mtha' yas pas shin tu 'phags pa /
analyzed: yon tan gyi rnam pa tshad @412b med pa'i ye shes mtha' yas pas shin tu 'phags pa /
translated: It is exalted by the wisdom of immeasurable aspects and infinite qualities.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang rab tu ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang rab tu ldan pa ste /
translated: It is endowed with the wisdom of omniscience, which is emptiness endowed with the supreme of all aspects.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: theg pa chen po de ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po de ni /
translated: this is the Great Vehicle.

original: de 'dra'o // skyes bu dam pa de dag de'i phyir go bgos nas mngon par zhugs te /
analyzed: de 'dra'o // skyes bu dam pa de dag de'i phyir go bgos nas mngon par zhugs te /
translated: Those holy beings, having donned the armor and set out,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam de la rab tu zhugs pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma thob kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas sems can rnams la nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam de la rab tu zhugs pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma thob kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas sems can rnams la nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: have entered the supramundane path. Although they have not yet attained omniscience, they are present for sentient beings through the activities of the buddhas.

original: lam dang / go cha dang / theg pa bkod pa 'di bstan pa na /
analyzed: lam dang / go cha dang / theg pa bkod pa 'di bstan pa na /
translated: When this teaching on the array of the path, the armor, and the vehicle was given,

original: lha dang mi'i srog chags bdun khri nyis stong ni /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i srog chags bdun khri nyis stong ni /
translated: seventy-two thousand gods and humans

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sum khri nyis stong ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sum khri nyis stong ni /
translated: Thirty-two thousand bodhisattvas

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam yongs su dag pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo ////
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam yongs su dag pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo ////
translated: Through the pure supramundane path, one attains the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyis zhus pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyis zhus pa /
translated: The Questions of Gaganagañja🔽Chapter Six

original: bam po drug pa; de nas byang chub sems dpa' rin chen dpal gyis byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: bam po drug pa; de nas byang chub sems dpa' rin chen dpal gyis byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' mdzod la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Ratnaprabha said to the bodhisattva Gaganagañja,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of good family,

original: khyod kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rnam par sbyangs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rnam par sbyangs so //
translated: you have purified the supramundane path.”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: He replied, “Son of good family,

original: bdag rnam par dag pas rnam par sbyangs so //
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag pas rnam par sbyangs so //
translated: I have purified it through the purity of the self.”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /🔽khyod ji ltar na /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu / khyod ji ltar na /
translated: Ratnaprabha asked, “Son of good family,

original: bdag rnam par @413a *//🔽dag / smras pa /
analyzed: bdag rnam par @413a *// dag / smras pa /
translated: how is it that you have purified the self?”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Gaganagañja replied, “Son of good family,

original: 'jig rten rnam par dag pas bdag rnam par dag go /
analyzed: 'jig rten rnam par dag pas bdag rnam par dag go /
translated: I have purified the self through the purity of the world.”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Ratnaprabha asked, “Son of good family,

original: 'jig rten rnam par dag pa 'di gang /
analyzed: 'jig rten rnam par dag pa 'di gang /
translated: what is the purity of the world?”

original: smras pa / gzugs sngon gyi mtha' rnam par dag pas 'pho ba'ang med /
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs sngon gyi mtha' rnam par dag pas 'pho ba'ang med /
translated: Gaganagañja replied, “The world is pure because form is pure from the beginning.

original: gzugs kyi phyi ma'i mtha' rnam par dag pas 'ong ba'ang med /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phyi ma'i mtha' rnam par dag pas 'ong ba'ang med /
